com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.budget

Class Budget

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.erikartymiuk.badbudgetlogic.budget.Budget

  • public class Budget
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing the user's total budget. Consists of a list of items to be budgeted, and also a set of preferences for the users budget.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Budget(Source budgetSource, boolean autoReset, int weeklyReset, int monthlyReset)
      Constructor for an empty budget starting with the specified settings

      Source getBudgetSource() 
      int getMonthlyReset()
      For items that have a frequency of monthly, the day of the month the user would like them to reset on (if auto) should match the specs for DAY_OF_MONTH given by Calendar class.
      int getWeeklyReset()
      For items that have a frequency of weekly, the day the user would like them to reset on at 12:00AM (if auto) should match the specs for DAY_OF_WEEK given by Calendar class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Budget

        public Budget(Source budgetSource,
              boolean autoReset,
              int weeklyReset,
              int monthlyReset)
       throws BadBudgetInvalidValueException
        Constructor for an empty budget starting with the specified settings
        Parameters:
        budgetSource - - the source for all budgetItems in this budget, cannot be null
        autoReset - - indicates if we should auto reset budget items
        weeklyReset - - For items that have a frequency of weekly, the day the user would like them to reset on at 12:00AM (if auto) should match the specs for DAY_OF_WEEK given by Calendar class.
        monthlyReset - - For items that have a frequency of monthly, the day of the month the user would like them to reset on (if auto) should match the specs for DAY_OF_MONTH given by Calendar class.
        Throws:
        BadBudgetInvalidValueException

    • Method Detail

      • verifyValues

        public static int verifyValues(Source budgetSource)
        Error checking method for a Budget. Ensures that the budget source and manual reset button are both set. Returns an error code indicating an error if one is found or 0 if none are found. Possible error codes are: 0 - Values are valid 1 - Budget source is not set
        Parameters:
        budgetSource - - the budget source
        Returns:
        - an int indicating an error or 0 if no errors were found

      • calculateNextLoss

        public java.util.Date calculateNextLoss(BudgetItem item,
                                        java.util.Date lastLoss)
        Given a budget item and the date of the last handled loss this method calculates the loss date that occurs after the handled loss using the reset values defined by this budget object
        Parameters:
        item - - the item we want the next loss calculated for. We use this items frequency
        lastLoss - - the date of the last handled loss, We use this as the starting point for calculating the next loss date.
        Returns:
        - the date of the next loss of item given that the last handled loss was lastLoss or null if their is no more losses

      • lossAmount

        public double lossAmount(BudgetItem item,
                         java.util.Date currentLoss)
        This method returns the loss amount for the given prorated item and the date of the current (unhandled) loss. For unhandled frequencies the full loss amount of the item is returned. (Currently allowed frequencies are weekly, monthly, and TODO yearly)
        Parameters:
        item - - the item to find the prorated loss amount for
        currentLoss - - the current date we are interested in for handling our loss
        Returns:
        the prorated loss amount for weekly, monthly, and yearly items else the full loss amount

      • addBudgetItem

        public void addBudgetItem(BudgetItem budgetItem)
        Adds this budgetItem to the budgets items
        Parameters:
        budgetItem - - the budget item to add

      • retrieveBudgetItem

        public BudgetItem retrieveBudgetItem(java.lang.String description)
        Gets the budgetItem with the given name/description (key)
        Parameters:
        description - - the description of the budget item to retrieve
        Returns:
        BudgetItem - the corresponding budget item or null if no such item exists

      • getAllBudgetItems

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,BudgetItem> getAllBudgetItems()
        Gets all of the users budget items as a map. The key is the budget item's description
        Returns:
        a map of all the user's budget items

      • getBudgetSource

        public Source getBudgetSource()

      • setBudgetSource

        public void setBudgetSource(Source budgetSource)
        Updates the budget source for this budget. Also takes care of updating any necessary links of budget items to the new budget source.
        Parameters:
        budgetSource - - the Source for this budget

      • setAutoReset

        public void setAutoReset(boolean autoReset)

      • isAutoReset

        public boolean isAutoReset()

      • getWeeklyReset

        public int getWeeklyReset()
        For items that have a frequency of weekly, the day the user would like them to reset on at 12:00AM (if auto) should match the specs for DAY_OF_WEEK given by Calendar class.
        Returns:
        - the day of the week this budget's weekly items reset

      • getMonthlyReset

        public int getMonthlyReset()
        For items that have a frequency of monthly, the day of the month the user would like them to reset on (if auto) should match the specs for DAY_OF_MONTH given by Calendar class.
        Returns:
        - the reset day of the month for monthly budget items

      • setWeeklyReset

        public void setWeeklyReset(int weekly)
        Setter for the weekly reset time.
        Parameters:
        weekly - - the day of the week (should match DAY_OF_WEEK in Calendar specs) to reset weekly budget items

      • setMonthlyReset

        public void setMonthlyReset(int monthly)
        Setter for the monthly reset time
        Parameters:
        monthly - - the day of the month (1-31 should match DAY_OF_MONTH given by Calendar class) to reset monthly budget items
